WRITING.TITLE: Opening Up (Sorry for length)
WRITING.TEXT:
First of all, I'm sorry if this gets lengthy and makes no sense. I just need to empty my head. I don't mean for this to be a pity-me post in any way at all. There are just some things that I'm realizing I need to open up about and be honest about if I'm EVER going to succeed at getting clean. I'm so scared and I don't know if I'm ready to tell the people in my life the things I need to. This sub has been a saving grace for me. So even if no one reads this, I need to get it out.
I'm 18 years old. I'm a freshman in college. Dream job, lobbyist. There's no way I'll ever get anywhere near there as a drug addict. I can't even tell anyone that that's what I want with my life. They all just laugh and say yeah right, be serious. That makes me so sad. I was about 15 when I had my first taste of opiates. It wasn't anything dramatic. My boyfriend, who was 18 at the time, just handed me a few pills and told me to take them. I'd been drunk and smoked before. But this.. was different. It was really an issue for a while. Every now and then, he'd hand me something, I'd take them without question. And then things..changed. He changed. I couldn't do anything right. He was always angry. I never knew why. I'd never had a boyfriend before, I was young. One day, I guess he just kinda snapped. I remember so clearly the first time he hit me. Looking back I just want to scream at myself to get the fuck away from him from that first time. But I just didn't know what to do. I left, started walking home. He pulled up next to me and apologized. I didn't know what to do. So I just got in his truck and went back to his house with him. That was the first night I felt like I needed the little white pills he gave me to numb out what was going on in my head. It got worse. And worse. I was spending more time getting ready in the mornings covering bruises than anything else. He was giving me pills more and more frequently. I was getting addicted without really even realizing it. When he'd get mad or have a bad day or something and come at me, I'd be telling myself that it would be okay and I get handle it because he'd give me something later. It was just getting so out of control. It all kind of blew up when he decided it was time for me to lose my virginity whether I wanted to or not. He was bigger than me so it didn't matter to him that I said no, that I was BEGGING him to stop. I finally got the guts to break up with him about a month after the first time. It's been three years today since the first time he took that from me. The past three years have been hell. I tried so hard to just pretend it didn't happen. But I could only keep it out of my head for so long. My use went up drastically. Things would flare every now and then with him. He'd leave me alone for a while. Then he'd start trying to get in touch with me, telling me he missed me. Or threatening me if I ever tried to tell anyone. The past 4 or 5 months (coincidentally about the same amount of time I've been trying to get clean) have been really bad. I think there's another girl getting ready to press charges. He's been pushing me a lot harder. I do the best I can to ignore him and stay away from him. But it's to the point that I leave the gym and he's waiting by my car. Or he's parked outside my apartment complex. I know it isn't excuse. But every time something happens with him, whether he's just talking shit or hitting me around or just..showing up somewhere. I break and call my dealer. I know people have way worse situations or have been through worse and handled it much better I do. And I know I can't blame my use on him. But I'm realizing, I feel like I CANNOT stay clean with him even vaguely a part of my life. I don't know how to deal with what he did to. I still have nightmares about it all time. I still struggle with day to day life because of it sometimes. I don't quite know how to fix what he broke inside of my head. But I'm realizing drugs aren't doing it. When I come down, the mess is still there. I'm trying to get something done. It's taken me three fucking years, but I've finally got the balls to do something. I think. I started the process of getting a restraining order. I thought about pressing charges. But I'm so so scared. I haven't told anyone in my life that I'm doing anything at all. I'm terrified of what he's going to do to me because I spoke up. Part of me just wants to drop everything all together because I don't know if I'm strong enough to deal with the drama that's going to open up. I just..... don't know what to do anymore.
It breaks my heart that I know he's done this to other girls. I feel so, so guilty for that. It's my fault. If I'd said something 3 years ago, maybe I could have saved them the same pain. I hate myself for the part I played in their heartache. Because I know exactly how awful it is and how much it fucks with every. single. part. of your life. I know what it did to mine. I'm angry and hurt and sad and confused and bitter and guilty and mad at myself and just...everything else. I don't even know how to explain it. I just feel so stuck on it. Like no matter what I do, I can't get it out of my head. I miss feeling safe. I don't get that every anymore.
Sorry again that this was a novel. If anyone actually read through it all. haha. I just... I know I'm never going to get and stay clean unless I figure this shit out first. I know there are a lot things that play into my drug use. But this is my biggest trigger and struggle. I don't know how, but I have to figure this out. And I will never be able to do that if I don't open my mouth and speak up about it. Thank you for giving me a place to open up and trying to figure shit out. You're all awesome. Much love.
